;

;The Mandarin Oriental Hotel is located on Wangfujing Street in Beijing, overlooking the Forbidden City. On the evening of October 25, 2023, in the luxurious conference hall box on the fifth floor, Oleg Deripaska, the founder of Rusal, was waiting for the visiting media.

;

;Oleg Deripaska was once the founder of the world's largest aluminum company. In the interview, he claimed to be a "Soviet-era physicist" and graduated from the Physics Department of Moscow State University in his early years. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, academic funding dropped sharply, and there were no subsidies or grants, which made it impossible for him to continue physics research.

;

;After leaving school, he and his colleagues established a trading company to export metals from Russia. Later, he used the first pot of gold he earned to acquire the third largest electrolytic aluminum plant in Russia, which became his The starting point of your career. Later, through asset merger, he established the world's largest aluminum company, Rusal. This company was listed in Hong Kong in 2015, becoming the first Russian company to be listed in China.

;

;In April 2018, the United States imposed sanctions on Deripaska and 23 other Russian tycoons and officials, and he was included in the United States' Specially Designated Nationals List (SDN). After entering this list, the Office of Foreign Assets Control under the U.S. Department of the Treasury will freeze its property and property interests within the jurisdiction of the United States. U.S. citizens and entities located in the United States are generally prohibited from conducting any form of transaction or business with individuals or entities on the SDN list.

;

;This list affects not only the individuals or entities on the list, but also third parties with whom they do business. Transactions with entities on the list may result in violations of U.S. sanctions regulations, thereby Face legal consequences.

;

;Oleg Deripaska was sanctioned by Australia, Canada, EU countries, the United Kingdom and other countries after the Russia-Ukraine conflict began.

;

;;

;

;Russian aluminum king Oleg Deripaska. ;(Zhou Yubo/Picture);

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What is the purpose of your visit to China this time? ;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska:;;I am a member of the Board of Trustees of Lomonosov Moscow State University. We visited BIT Moscow State University in Shenzhen , a joint university founded by Lomonosov Moscow State University and Beijing Institute of Technology. ;

;

;We have opened an International Business School, as well as a School of Mathematics and Physics. Previously, Moscow State University held an international class. About twenty or thirty students from different countries came to Moscow State University to study mathematics and physics, and 30% of them were Chinese students.

;

;Russian mathematics education is the best in the world, and we hope to promote such academic exchanges. At the same time, Chinese students can learn Russian, and Russian students can learn Chinese. We need to invest in transportation facilities and financial facilities, but we also need to invest in science education. Some scientific projects may not seem very important now, but in twenty or fifty years, they will become the key to the development of human society.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How do you view the current fluctuations in the ruble? ;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska:;;The problem of ruble fluctuations certainly exists because we now have a military conflict, but Russia’s settlement balance is still very powerful. As long as there are no major conflicts in the next two or three years, ruble fluctuations will not be a big problem, because Russia's resource industry is still quite good. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;At the beginning of the year, you thought Russia needed to welcome more people from Investment from friendly countries, so what else can be done to promote cooperation between Chinese and Russian enterprises? ;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska:;;First, it takes time. The foundation of economic cooperation between the two countries is trust. We already have a foundation of trust. . Previously, 70% of Russian industry relied on European technology. Now it still takes time to transform, change our national standards, and cooperate with our friendly countries. ;

;

;If you have a problem, you must solve it in time, and don't let it accumulate later. Entrepreneurs, including me, have raised this question before, why is Russia’s foreign trade so unbalanced? 80% comes from Europe and 20% comes from Asia. We need to find a balance. In the next two or three years, we will work hard to solve the problems that have not been solved before.

;

;Second, we must invest in infrastructure, not just logistics facilities, but also financial platforms. The financial platform is not just a settlement issue. The two countries have learned how to settle in their own currencies, but the debt market has not yet achieved the results we want.

;

;Ten years ago, the Russian automobile industry began to talk about import substitution, but they did not start to do it until the problems had arisen. Five or 10 years ago, it was unimaginable that the United States would do this.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Have the sanctions imposed on you by the United States seriously affected your life? Will it affect you psychologically? ;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska: ;;From a psychological point of view, I don’t think it has a big impact. I served in the army during the Soviet period and encountered even more severe situations. Since then, I have had a different attitude and understanding of danger. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why were you sanctioned by the US Treasury Department? ;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska:;;In 2017, one of my companies was listed in London and successfully attracted US$2 billion in investment. Five months later, my company and I were included in the sanctions list. ;

;

;They mentioned various excuses, but in fact there was no legal reason to put me on the sanctions list.

;

;One excuse is that at the Davos Forum in Dalian, I gave a speech that mentioned the establishment of a unified energy market in the East, but the real theme of my speech was to promote the development of nuclear energy.

;

;At that time, aluminum prices rose by 70%, and speculators made a lot of money. This goes to show that if you don't take into account the dangers and hope for a good partnership, sooner or later the dangers will materialize.

;

;;

;

;On October 19, 2021, in Washington, DC, the United States, the FBI searched several properties of Oleg Deripaska. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Will sanctions affect the lives of you and your family? ;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska: ;;For me personally, there is no impact at all. From a young age, I didn’t have many material needs. For others, especially if their children study abroad, the impact is quite large. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You have been sanctioned very early. Have any friends come to you to ask for advice? ;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska:;;Yes, I have extensive experience in dealing with sanctions from Western countries. ;

;

;My conclusion is to invest in countries that do not rely on the Western financial system. If there is an extreme conflict between any country and the United States, no one will abide by the law, and these real estate and projects will be taken away.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Do you feel sad when your property is taken away? ;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska: ;;To be honest, I don’t have any special feelings. I am not a person who cares about material things very much. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How can we not worry about being sanctioned?;

; span>;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska:;;Without independence, this will always be a problem. If you just lack certain supplies, you can still survive in five or ten years. I think the world is aware of this danger. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Is the independence you are talking about a kind of isolationism? ? ;

;

;;Oleg Deripaska: ;;Of course not. We are facing global problems, such as climate change, poverty, disease, etc. However, sanctions will not promote the development of a certain country. Only trust between countries, only economic cooperation and mutually beneficial development between countries can solve these global problems. ;

;

;Will Western sanctions make the sanctioned countries change their policies? Will not. Everyone would still be able to survive without Tesla cars.

;

;On the contrary, these sanctions will make us rethink our own development and fill some loopholes and shortcomings. For example, promoting the development of transportation and logistics, improving our financial market, and conducting settlement in local currency. We must build a new international security system and a new international relations system to avoid new crises.

;

;The previous world was centered on the West, that is, all technologies and investments were initially determined by Western countries, which also led to many regional conflicts.

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 14:25:02 +0800 不清楚孩子上了什么学，回家陪读三年仅是一次情感弥补？http://www.infzm.com/contents/259687
;;2023-11-02 13:00:00;
;

;Downstairs where I work, there is a circle of shops, including restaurants, small supermarkets, fruit and vegetable shops, and morning stalls. The shop... is surrounded by an industrial park, and there is only one commercial place around. It is very lively here during meals and commuting, and these shops are running well. I have been working here since the building was built, and most of these shops have been operating here since the beginning, so I know many of the merchants and often chat with them while shopping.

;

;Three years ago, the proprietress of the Shaxian snack bar downstairs returned to Fujian to accompany her children in high school. Recently, I saw her when I was eating at a snack bar in Shaxian County, and asked, "Are you back from studying with me?" She said, "Back!" I asked again, "Which university did your child go to after the college entrance examination?" She scratched her head and answered. : "I don't know!" I asked: "You have been studying with your child for three years, and you have achieved results after three years. You don't know what your results are?" She still shook her head and said, "I really don't know...anyway ...It seems to be from our side..."

;

;Two days later, I went to the small supermarket nearby to buy something. The small supermarket was run by a couple, they were from Anhui, and the male owner I am explaining to the hostess, don’t forget to transfer living expenses to the child. I asked, "Is your child going to college?" They nodded and said they just went to college this year. I continued to ask: "Which university does the child go to?" The male host lowered his head and thought for a moment, and said, "I can't remember either." I looked at the hostess, and she said, "Don't ask me, I can't either." I know..." the male host interjected, "He said he was in Chengdu... studying design... or something else..." I couldn't help but be dumbfounded and joked: "You two don't know what's important! You two only know how to transfer it to your children. Living expenses!" They both looked at each other, not understanding what I was laughing at.

;

;Nowadays, most couples or one spouse works outside the home and the children study in their hometown. If one spouse works outside the home, the life of the spouse at home will focus on the child's studies and spend time accompanying them to school. Both husband and wife work outside the home, and many people choose to go back to study with their children at some important stages and moments, such as the third year of junior high school, the third year of high school, etc. This is all in the hope that by accompanying them to study, they can help their children learn so that they can get into the ideal school. However, when I heard that the proprietress of a snack bar in Shaxian County accompanied her child to high school for three years and did not know what university the child finally went to, I thought that the effectiveness of accompanying him to study is questionable. It should be about the same whether he studies with him or not. , the three years of accompanying her were probably just an emotional make-up. When I heard that the couple in the small supermarket did not know the school and major their children were studying in, I was thinking that this seemed to be someone else’s business. The essence of university education is to pay for living expenses with your head covered. It is an education that is at a loss. invest.

;

;The day before yesterday, I called a water station downstairs and asked the store to send me a bucket of bottled water. The store responded that it could not be delivered, and there was no one in the store. The child was about to enter high school, and the wife went home to study with the child. If she wanted water, she would bring it herself. Originally, I could call another water station to have water delivered, but after the previous two experiences and my thinking, I immediately decided to go downstairs to carry water.

;

;I went to the water station and asked the shopkeeper: "Why does your wife want to go home to study with you?"

;

;"Then everyone is accompanying you, so it's impossible for us not to accompany you!" the shopkeeper replied .

;

;"What else can I do when I go back to study with me?"

;

;"What else can I do, cook, wash clothes, supervise my children not to play with mobile phones..."

;

;"Like this Is it interesting to study with you?"

;

;The shop owner chuckled: "We don't know about that... They say it's difficult to take the high school entrance examination now... I'm afraid I won't be able to pass..."

;

;I am not an educator myself , but I think there are some basic intellectual things that should be similar. I said to the shopkeeper, take the notes and I will tell you what time it is. I told him with my fingers: 1. Clarify your child's learning goals, which can be specific to which school he wants to attend, and understand the school's enrollment plan, enrollment requirements, and performance requirements. requirements and performance requirements as the program; 2. Maintain close contact with school teachers, understand the school’s learning progress and children’s learning situation, and solve possible learning problems in a timely manner. The basic problems should be grasped and the difficult problems should be overcome. ; 3. Your spouse should establish a good work and rest system, and supervise the child to balance work and rest during the learning process. When it is time to study and when it is time to rest, if you want the child not to play with mobile phones, first of all, she must not play with the mobile phone while the child is studying; 4. Don't use your emotional compensation as a moral standard to ask your children. Encourage your children to learn, but you must also respect your children's willingness to learn. 5. Caring for your children is long-term. It does not end when you enter high school in the future. Children are independent. However, your child's study and life are not independent. They are an expression of your family's common wishes and are closely related to your daily life.

;

;I finished speaking, and the shopkeeper also finished memorizing it, but he blinked, not knowing whether he understood or not. I told him that we would continue the discussion the next time I came to carry water.

;

;Reading to your children is not just about doing laundry and cooking, nor is it as easy a job as sitting aside and playing with your mobile phone while asking your children to do homework and answer mock tests. What is the goal, what are the plans to achieve the goal, how to correct errors in the process of implementing the plan, how to achieve long-term emotional interaction after the plan is realized, how to make up for the failure of the plan, etc. These issues should be considered by the accompanying parents. of.

;

;There is a fruit and vegetable shop downstairs. The proprietress of the fruit and vegetable shop also came back from school soon. I asked her: "How did my child do in the exam?"

;

;She replied: "I passed the exam. But the school is not very good, and the child has to repeat the year."

;

;I asked: "Will you no longer accompany me during the repeat year?"

;

;She said: "I won't accompany you anymore. , I’ve had enough company, it’s up to him how he does in the next year’s exam, let him go!”

;

;It’s dinner time, people in the industrial park and people upstairs all come upstairs It's time to eat and consume, and the merchants are busy again. Looking at them being busy, I think about the children behind them who are still studying. I don’t know which universities, high schools or other places of study those children are in. I just hope that they will be healthy in body and mind and make progress every day.

;

;(The author is a practitioner in Shanghai fruit industry)

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 13:25:03 +0800 李佳琦直播间卖假和田玉？谈谈玉的文化、国标及科学http://www.infzm.com/contents/259724
;;2023-11-02 12:00:00;
;

;After online anchor Li Jiaqi was accused by JD.com’s purchasing staff of forcing him to “choose one from two” and questioned the alleged monopoly, he went on a professional crackdown on counterfeiting Wang Hai also questioned whether the Hetian jade sold in Li Jiaqi's live broadcast room was fake.

;

;Jade is a unique culture in China. The Chinese ancestors selected the "beautiful stones" from various stones. Jade is warm, shiny, meticulous and tough, so it is also considered by the Chinese to be benevolent and benevolent. Justice, wisdom, courage, and purity are the five moral qualities. Wearing jade has the effect of preventing evil spirits.

;

;The Chinese ancestors’ understanding of jade can be traced back to the Neolithic Age. Humans ground stone tools as tools for chopping and scraping, hunting, and cutting meat. Some ground stone tools showed a smooth and beautiful appearance, and humans began to have a preliminary understanding of jade. This also marks the beginning of the transition of human beings from material needs to spiritual needs. Archaeological research has found that in the late Neolithic Age, many jade products and jade ornaments appeared. At this time, the ancients had realized that jade and stone had completely different functions and aesthetics.

;

;Around 3000 BC, jade craftsmanship was separated from stone tool processing technology and became an independent craft category. Based on the production traces left on the jades unearthed from the Hongshan Cultural Site and the Liangzhu Cultural Site, experts have inferred that a rotating jade processing tool - a weight machine - had appeared at that time. This is no different in principle from the jade processing machines we see now. The Shang and Zhou dynasties were the growth stage of Chinese jade art. The scope of use of jade expanded, and the number and types increased significantly. However, the shapes were still very simple, with only sporadic decorations. Hotan jade also appeared in this era for the first time.

;

;In the Spring and Autumn Period and the Warring States Period, the art of jade carving developed. At that time, scholar-bureaucrats wore a series of jade ornaments all over their bodies. What reflected the spirit of the times at that time were a large number of jade pendants in the shapes of dragons, phoenixes and tigers, with complex and beautiful shapes and strong Chinese style and national characteristics. The jade pieces of the Tang Dynasty are all treasures. The craftsmanship was further developed and refined. The texture is warm and the luster is soft. Gold and jade complement each other, making them rich and elegant. In the Song Dynasty, jade gradually entered people's lives. Influenced by calligraphy and painting at that time, the style became more realistic and full of life. During the Ming and Qing Dynasties, jade art reached its peak, and various types of exquisite jade articles emerged in endlessly.

;

;The definition of real jade and non-real jade has long been reflected in the system of jade use in Chinese history. Hotan jade is the highest level of jade, it is real jade, and is used by emperors. After countless years, Hotan jade has just entered the folk world. The one that caused the controversy this time was Hetian jade.

;

;Facing Wang Hai’s doubts, Yuanyang Jinlou, the owner of the cargo in Li Jiaqi’s live broadcast room, posted the appraisal certificates, including the National Jewelry and Jade Quality Supervision and Inspection Center (NGTC), Guangdong Gold and Silver Jewelry Testing Center Co., Ltd., National Gold and Silver Products Quality Inspection and Testing Center (Nanjing) Organization, Shenzhen Zhongdi Jewelry Testing Co., Ltd. These institutions are not without authority. So, what is the problem?

;

;The first is the question of whether it is fake. According to Wang Hai, GB/T38821-2020 stipulates that the appraisal certificate must have total mass and physical photos, and consumers received 18 appraisal certificates attached to the necklace. Not only are each 40g, but they are also photos of a shared necklace. , then it is suspected of fraud.

;

;In fact, the problem of counterfeiting is easy to solve, but what is difficult to solve is the second level problem, which is the standard issue.

;

;The standards used by these institutions are the national Hetian jade testing standards GB/T16552-2017 and GB/T16553-2017. This 2017 standard does not clearly stipulate the specific content of tremolite. As long as the main component is tremolite, it can be named "Hetian Jade".

;

;Wang Hai adopts another standard, namely GB/T 38831-2020. The GB/T38821-2020 "Hetian Jade Identification and Classification" launched in 2020 was developed by the State Administration for Market Regulation and China Released by the National Standardization Administration Committee, it is the latest national standard for the Hetian jade industry. The mineral composition of Hetian jade is described as: "Mainly composed of tremolite, the secondary mineral can be actinolite, and can contain a small amount of calcite, diopside, pyrite, pyrite, chromite, and magnetite. , quartz, serpentine, chlorite, epidote, wollastonite, apatite and garnet, etc." According to this standard, the naming rule is: when the percentage of other minerals in the same piece of jade is less than 5%, Hetian jade can be named directly. When the percentage of other minerals is more than 5% (except black jade), if the other minerals contained are evenly distributed and the boundaries of the mineral particles are clear, use "tremolite jade" with a note indicating that it contains other minerals. For example: tremolite jade (including tremolite jade) carbonates).

;

;Then, things are clear. Both standards are used in the industry. The 2017 standard is more relaxed, while the 2020 standard is more stringent. However, this standard is not mandatory and is only a recommended standard. Jade sellers adopted the loose standards introduced in 2017, saying that their items were Hetian jade; while Wang Hai, who fights against counterfeiters, adopted a stricter standard in 2020, saying that the jade sold by Li Jiaqi was fake and did not meet the standards.

;

;Objectively speaking, jade has been difficult to identify clearly since ancient times. What exactly is jade? In fact, many people don't understand. When we talk about what a thing is, it is actually a chemical question. Chemistry is the study of the composition of matter.

;

;From a chemical perspective, jade is actually a mixture. When we talk about gold, we refer to the material composed of gold atoms; when we talk about quartz, we refer to silicon dioxide; when we talk about ice, we refer to dihydrogen monoxide. Of course, minerals are mixed with other impurities, but in an abstract sense, these things are composed of single atoms or single compound molecules. But jade, in an abstract sense, is a mixture. For example, just like when we talk about Chinese medicinal soup and borscht soup, even in an abstract sense, it must be a mixture of multiple ingredients. Therefore, jade is a mixture, which is a mixture of two or more compounds and elements.

;

;With this concept, it is easier to understand jade. Jade has different chemical compositions, different colors, and different types. The chemical composition of jadeite is sodium aluminum silicate, the most representative of which is jadeite. The chemical composition of nephrite is hydrous calcium magnesium silicate, the most representative of which is Hetian jade.

;

;Specifically, Hetian jade has four main mineral components: silicon, aluminum, iron and magnesium. Silicon accounts for a large proportion of Hetian jade, and its main forms are calcium silicate (CaSiO;3;), magnesium silicate (MgSiO;3;), and sodium disilicate (Na< sub>;2;Si;2;O;5;), etc.; the aluminum element is mainly albite (NaAlSi;3;O; 8;), and also contains a small amount of aluminum silicate; iron mainly exists in the form of potassium ferroaluminate and iron silicate. It can be seen that Hetian jade has many ingredients.

;

;The charm of jade, its appeal to people in terms of look and feel, stems from this characteristic of jade's chemical composition. This has also caused various confusions in the naming, identification, and even price of jade. Some people say that the wholesale price of jade sold by Li Jiaqi is only a few dozen yuan. But then again, the wholesale price of tens of thousands of jade in those tourist attractions and jewelry stores may only be a few hundred yuan or less. This is the characteristic of the jade industry. As the old saying goes, "Gold has a price, jade is priceless." This does not mean that gold is not as valuable as jade, and jade is a priceless treasure. It means that the price of jade has been confusing and confusing since ancient times, and the profits are often abnormally high.

;

;Li Jiaqi’s live broadcast room is said to have the lowest price on the entire Internet. Consumers believe it, but there is a gap between their expectations and reality. In fact, if you really want to buy cost-effective jade, the live broadcast room is not a good place. Only knowledgeable people with instruments can identify, and only with the ability to identify can we negotiate a good price. Obviously, most consumers cannot do this.

;

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 12:25:04 +0800 过度加工食物可能成瘾并严重影响健康http://www.infzm.com/contents/259641
;;2023-11-02 11:00:00;
;

;;

;

;; (Visual China/Picture) ;

;

;Over-processing of food refers to industrial production and the addition of at least 5 or more ingredients, additives (usually sugar, stabilizers, preservatives, preservatives, pigments), etc., in this way Processed foods are called ultra-processed foods. Their purpose is to make them delicious and convenient, and more importantly, manufacturers can earn higher profits.

;

;Excessively processed foods include soft drinks such as cola, bread, cakes, potato chips, pizza, biscuits, candies, burgers, instant noodles, ice cream, spicy sticks, etc. More and more research results show that the intake of overly processed foods may be harmful to human health and increase the risk of various diseases.

;

;A recent study by Brazilian researchers suggests that overly processed foods may harm brain function. The reason is that overly processed foods contain many added and unhealthy ingredients such as sugar, salt, fat, artificial colors and preservatives. Past research has shown that overly processed foods are directly linked to an increased risk of heart disease, metabolic syndrome, and obesity, and now research is linking overly processed foods to a risk of decreased brain function.

;

;The researchers collected data on nearly 11,000 men and women in Brazil with an average age of 52 who participated in the Brazilian Longitudinal Study of Adult Health. The researchers followed them for a long time, with a median follow-up time of 8 years. The results found that participants who consumed more than 20% of their daily calories from ultra-processed foods experienced a 28% faster decline in overall cognitive function and a 25% faster decline in executive function compared to adults over 59 years old. In other words, the decline in cognitive function and executive function is more obvious among adults aged 35-59. Overall, overall cognitive functions include learning ability and memory, while executive functions include language fluency and behavioral agility.

;

;However, the researchers admit that they cannot yet explain the mechanism by which excessively processed foods lead to reduced brain function, and there is no neuroimaging to confirm their results. Therefore, future research is to explore which overly processed foods lead to cognitive decline in the body and the molecular mechanisms behind it.

;

;One possible explanation, however, is that when people regularly consume overly processed foods, they are less likely to get the fiber, microbes, minerals, and plants they need to stay healthy, fight off disease, and reduce inflammation. Nutrients. Ultimately, this may affect a person's brain function and functioning, as the brain requires a steady supply of these nutrients to function properly.

;

;Overly processed foods have also been linked to cancer. Researchers from Imperial College London have found that high intakes of ultra-processed foods may increase an individual's risk of developing cancer and dying from cancer. Previously, a large number of studies have revealed that consuming large amounts of overly processed food will increase the incidence of obesity, type 2 diabetes, and cardiovascular disease. Now, British researchers have used the British Biobank to collect dietary information from 200,000 young people to study the relationship between body health and diet. This is the first such study to be conducted in the UK. The researchers monitored the people's health for 10 years, analyzing their risk of developing any cancer and 34 types of cancer, as well as the participants' risk of dying from cancer.

;

;Researchers conducted the most comprehensive assessment to date of the link between overly processed foods and people’s risk of developing cancer, including soda, industrially produced bread, and more. Ready-to-eat meals and most breakfast cereals. These foods often contain high levels of salt, sugar, fat, and artificial additives.

;

;The results show that people who eat a lot of overly processed foods are at a greater risk of developing cancer. Overly processed foods are particularly related to ovarian cancer and brain cancer. They also increase an individual's risk of death from cancer, most obviously. of ovarian and breast cancer. For every 10% increase in a person's intake of overly processed foods in a person's diet, the overall risk of cancer increases by 2%, and the risk of ovarian cancer in particular increases by 19%. It is associated with a 6% increase in overall cancer mortality, a 16% increase in the risk of death from breast cancer, and a 30% increase in the risk of death from ovarian cancer.

;

;The association between excessively processed food intake and cancer remained after adjusting for social, economic, behavioral and dietary factors such as smoking, physical activity and body mass index (BMI). Furthermore, previous research has shown that British adults and children consume the highest amounts of ultra-processed food in Europe.

;

;Although the study by British researchers cannot explain the causal relationship and mechanism between over-processed foods and cancer, they believe that existing research evidence shows that reducing the intake of over-processed foods in the daily diet may avoid Higher cancer rates.

;

;Overly processed food has become widespread around the world and is addictive. A research report published in the British Medical Journal on October 9, 2023 by researchers from the United States, Brazil, and Spain pointed out that an analysis of 281 studies in 36 different countries found that 14% of adults and adults worldwide 12% of children are addicted to over-processed foods, and 1/7 adults and 1/8 children may be addicted to over-processed foods. These foods include ice cream, carbonated drinks and convenience foods, which can lead to cancer, obesity and Increased risk of heart disease.

;

;In addition, the consumption of ultra-processed foods is soaring around the world, and now more than half of the daily energy intake in the UK comes from ultra-processed foods. In the United States, ultra-processed foods account for 58% of Americans’ energy intake.

;

;The fact that so many people eat over-processed foods suggests that they are addictive. Researchers explain the addiction to over-processed foods as higher levels of dopamine secretion may lead to over-processed foods. of addiction. Extracellular dopamine levels in the brain's striatum caused by refined carbohydrates or fats are similar to those of addictive substances such as nicotine and alcohol, thus creating a craving similar to alcoholism. Therefore, foods that contain high amounts of refined carbohydrates or added fats are likely to be addictive substances. The speed at which these overly processed foods deliver carbohydrates and fats to the intestines may also play a role in their addictive nature.

;

;Symptoms of addiction to over-processed foods include: strong desire to eat, withdrawal symptoms, difficulty controlling food intake, and obesity, overeating, poor physical and mental health, and reduced quality of life. Despite this, he continued to eat without restraint.

;

;All of this suggests that the relationship between overly processed foods and health, as well as the addictive nature of such foods, should be further studied, and appropriate measures should be taken to protect people's health.

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 11:25:04 +0800 北京香山论坛：大国小国，平等对话http://www.infzm.com/contents/259763

;"'Ten' means maturity, perfection, harvest, and also indicates a new starting point and renewal. Let’s go.” On the morning of October 30, 2023, Zhang Youxia, Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission, told officials from the defense departments of many countries.

;

;The 10th Beijing Xiangshan Forum was held from October 29th to 31st, reaching the highest level and largest scale in history - more than 90 official delegations from countries and international organizations participated, including 19 defense ministers , 14 military commander-level representatives.

;

;On the podium at the opening ceremony, the "ten" in "The 10th Beijing Xiangshan Forum" was painted in red. In the audience, foreign defense ministers, representatives of international institutions and experts are looking forward to an "international security event".

;

;;;;

;

;On October 30, Zhang Youxia, Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission, delivered a keynote speech. (Photo by Lu Huiqian)

;

;“Great powers play a more important role”

;

;At nine o’clock in the morning on October 30, the main venue on the second floor of the Beijing International Convention Center was packed with seats. Dozens of defense ministers and senior representatives from various countries in military uniforms sat in the front row of the auditorium; the back row was divided into two floors and filled with nearly a thousand experts, observers or media members.

;

;"Common Security, Lasting Peace" is marked with white letters on a blue background inside and outside the venue - this is the theme of the 10th Beijing Xiangshan Forum and the core idea of ​​the Global Security Initiative in February 2023.

;

;Zhang Youxia pointed out that without mutual respect, it will be difficult to coexist peacefully, and common security will be out of the question.

;

;Among the 19 defense ministers participating in the Beijing Xiangshan Forum, Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu was the first speaker. Before the opening ceremony, Shaoyigu and Zhang Youxia walked into the main venue side by side and sat in the center of the first row.

;

;“Russia-China relations are exemplary and are increasingly attractive to other countries.” Shoigu mentioned, “The circle of friends between Russia and China who do not want to be involved in the Western confrontation agenda is constantly expanding.”

;

;As a country involved in the Russia-Ukraine conflict, Shoigu’s attendance attracted much attention. He mentioned that after Russia countered NATO's eastward expansion, the United States was using Ukraine to attack Russia.

;

;"Russia will only use nuclear weapons when it is attacked by a nuclear attack or when its national survival is threatened." Shoigu said in his speech.

;

;This is the second time that Shaoyigu has attended the Beijing Xiangshan Forum and delivered a keynote speech. The last time was in 2019. After the meeting, Zhang Youxia held talks with Shaoyigu at the Bayi Building in Beijing.

;

;;;;

;

;Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu attended the Beijing Xiangshan Forum. (Photo by Lu Huiqian)

;

;The speeches of the guests at the first plenary session all closely followed the theme of "Responsibility of Major Powers and Global Security Cooperation."

;

;"It is important to strive for peace. In promoting global peace and security, major powers play a more important role." ASEAN Secretary-General Gao Jinhong said in the second half of the first half that major powers promote peace and make war a Obsolete things.

;

;“From Asia-Pacific to the Global”

;

;A few days before the opening ceremony, defense ministers and representatives from various countries arrived in Beijing one after another. As the organizer, Zhao Xiaozhuo, deputy director of the Beijing Xiangshan Forum Secretariat, is extremely busy.

;

;At around 21:00 on the evening of October 29, when Southern Weekend reporters met Zhao Xiaozhuo, he had just finished the welcome dinner.

;

;Recalling the first forum, Zhao Xiaozhuo still has fresh memories. "At that time, most of the participants were scholars, and the total number of participants was only a few dozen, so it was very small." Zhao Xiaozhuo told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;The Beijing Xiangshan Forum was founded in 2006 and is hosted by two think tanks from the Chinese military, the China Society of Military Science and the China Society for International Strategic Studies. In 2014, the forum was upgraded from track two (private) to track one and a half (semi-official, semi-private).

;

;"Since then, military and political leaders and national leaders will appear every year, and the conference has been adjusted from once every two years to once a year." Zhao Xiaozhuo said.

;

;Farewell to online meetings during the epidemic, the 10th Beijing Xiangshan Forum attracted official delegations from more than 90 countries and international organizations including Russia, the United States, Saudi Arabia, and Iran, with more than 1,800 participants.

;

;In the past 9 forums, there have been as many as 6 forums with the theme of "Asia-Pacific". With the major changes in the nature of the forum, the scope of topics has also expanded from Asia-Pacific affairs to global issues.

;

;Wu Xinbo, Dean of the Institute of International Studies at Fudan University, is a frequent visitor to the Beijing Xiangshan Forum. Since the first forum in 2006, he has attended the forum almost every year. He said, "The theme of the forum is increasingly consistent with China's core concepts and basic principles of international security, and the topics of the sub-forums are also increasingly consistent with the current actual international security situation."

;

;;;;

;

;October 30 On the same day, the first plenary session of the 10th Beijing Xiangshan Forum was held. (Photo by Lu Huiqian)

;

;On the evening of October 30, ten small closed-door seminars were held simultaneously, covering topics such as global security governance, artificial intelligence security, and Sino-US crisis management and control. "It has never happened before that ten meetings can be held at the same time." Zhao Xiaozhuo said, "It is up to the participating representatives to choose which forum they want to go to, who they want to talk to, and how much they want to talk."

;

; Shi Chande, a researcher at the Institute for Defense Analyses and former deputy assistant secretary of defense, is an "old friend" of the Beijing Xiangshan Forum and a well-known "China expert."

;

;“I pay attention to China every day, and my understanding here may be deeper than that of the United States.” He told Southern Weekend reporters with a smile before the “Northeast Asian Order” sub-forum. The United States first sent official representatives to the Beijing Xiangshan Forum in 2015. Four years later, in 2019, then-U.S. Assistant Secretary of Defense Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense Shi Chande led a team to attend the meeting. It was the first time that a current senior U.S. military official appeared.

;

;“In the early days, the U.S. delegation’s participation in the Beijing Xiangshan Forum was relatively low, and basically only the military attache from the embassy in China was sent to participate.” Wu Xinbo recalled that as the importance and influence of the forum increased, the United States began to start from domestic Send some mid-level delegations.

;

;“Similar to the Shangri-La Summit and the Munich Security Conference, an official’s rank determines his stage. This is a common international practice.” Zhao Xiaozhuo said, “After lower-level officials arrive, they are often only responsible for collecting information. Various opinions and information."

;

;In 2018, the U.S. military delegation was led by Owen Lewis, dean of the Joint Forces Staff College of the U.S. National Defense University; previously, the president of the U.S. National Defense University also led a delegation to Beijing Xiangshan Forum.

;

;This time, Carles, senior director for China affairs in the Office of the Deputy Secretary of Defense of the United States, took over the "baton" from the head of the delegation.

;

;"The levels of Carles and Shi Chande are similar, but in terms of specific ranking, Shi Chande is higher." During the welcome dinner, Zhao Xiaozhuo specially analyzed the level setting of U.S. officials to the U.S. Navy Feng Dewei, vice president of the center, asked for advice.

;

;Calles, the official leader of the US delegation at this forum, kept a low profile and rarely appeared in public. On the evening of October 30, she appeared at a small seminar on "China-U.S. Crisis Management", but did not speak. She only briefly communicated with the participants after the meeting.

;

;However, "the level of the participants in the forum is not the most important matter. The communication between the two parties focuses on the substantive content." Wu Qian, spokesperson of the Ministry of National Defense, pointed out at a press conference held before the opening of the forum.

;

;International Issues "Desktop Collision"

;

;At 15:00 on October 29, half an hour before the official start of the meeting, the conference room with less than 100 people was packed with people from all over the world. Representatives, experts and media, etc. This is a dialogue titled "China's Role in Maintaining Asia-Pacific Security." Under the chairmanship of Wu Xinbo, experts from China, the United States, Russia and South Korea took their seats in turn.

;

;"Why can the Asia-Pacific maintain stability for thirty years?" The host first asked the question.

;

;Fu Ying, a former Chinese diplomat, shared "the reasons for the Asia-Pacific economic miracle": peace and stability, focus on regional cooperation and dialogue, and economic globalization.

;

;She gave data from the Bank of Asia, "In the past 42 years, Asia's GDP has grown seven times. Nearly half of it was created by China."

;

;And the United States' GDP has grown seven times. Michael Swan, chief director of the East Asia Project at the Western Institute of National Affairs, believes that "the change of power between China and the United States will bring huge uncertainty to Asia. In the next 10 to 15 years, the process of peace and stability in Asia may be disrupted."

;

;Shi Wen's view was refuted by Fu Ying: "Today, China is the driving force of the development miracle in the Asia-Pacific region, and the United States has also benefited greatly from it, but now this has become a problem?" Fu Ying said, The United States has launched a "China-US trade war" that has more gains than losses.

;

;;;;

;

;In the celebrity dialogue on October 29, Fu Ying refuted American scholar Shi Wen. (Photo by Yao Yijiang)

;

;Later, Russian expert Karaganov mentioned that "Russia wants to create a peaceful and stable Eurasia and Asia-Pacific." Karaganov is the dean of the School of World Economics and International Affairs at the Russian State Higher University of Economics.

;

;“This scene better reflects the current international security situation.” After listening to the whole process, Zhao Xiaozhuo told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;At the "Northeast Asia Security Trends and Shaping" parallel forum on the afternoon of the 30th, explosive scenes took place one after another. American scholar Shi Wen and Director of the Asian and African Studies Department of the Japanese Defense Research Institute Masuda Masayuki were criticized by Chinese scholars one after another.

;

;“The Northeast Asian issue depends on the interaction of multinational relations between China, Japan, the United States, and South Korea.” Shi Wen said. He was the third speaker at this forum, and there were also scholars from China, Russia, South Korea and the UK.

;

;Shi Wen flicked the tablet on the armrest of his seat, trying to regard the North Korean nuclear issue and the Taiwan issue as the same type of regional conflict.

;

;Soon, the moderator of the sub-forum, Vice President of the China Institute of International Strategic Studies, and retired major general Du Nongyi made his point clear, "The core of the Taiwan issue is China's sovereignty and territorial integrity. It has nothing to do with North Korea." Nuclear issues and other issues cannot be compared with each other."

;

;In the second half, Japanese scholar Masuda Masayuki became the target of public criticism because he blamed China for regional security problems.

;

;Yang Xuguang, senior adviser to the China Institute for International Strategic Studies, took the microphone and changed his original speech. He said that Masuda Masayuki was trying to teach the Chinese people "a lesson". "It is true that I am a little speechless."

;

;Yang Xuguang pointed out that the crux of the problem between China and Japan is rooted in Japan's psychological imbalance, trying to regard the Sino-US game as a "rare opportunity" to take action, and constantly pointing fingers at the Taiwan issue. .

;

;During the rebuttal, Masuda Masayuki sat on the stage and smiled awkwardly.

;

;Let developing countries have a voice

;

;In the international public opinion field dominated by European and American countries, the voices of developing countries are rarely heard.

;

;"Although it is a global village, every country has its own goals." At the "Chinese and Foreign Young Officers and Scholars Seminar" on October 29, Chief Executive Officer of the Pakistan Balochistan Research and Development Think Tank Official Jawariya Tareen said frankly. The young American scholar next to her had a serious expression.

;

;For more than seventy years, the India-Pakistan border issue has remained unresolved, and Kashmir has always been like a thorn in the relationship between the two countries. Jawariya mentioned that every time Pakistan wanted to have dialogue, India did not respond positively, and the relationship between the two sides only stopped at the think tank level.

;

;"Developing countries face two major problems, one is development and the other is security." Lieutenant General He Lei of the Chinese Academy of Military Sciences told Southern Weekend reporters that in a sense, developing countries are the most important problems in today's world. The security demands of the "vulnerable groups" should receive more attention and reasonable concerns.

;

;In addition to the Beijing Xiangshan Forum, internationally renowned security forums include the Shangri-La Dialogue, the Halifax International Security Forum, the Munich Security Conference and the Seoul Defense Dialogue.

;

;"These forums have obvious 'circle' attributes, and developing countries do not have much room to express themselves." Zhao Xiaozhuo mentioned that only the Beijing Xiangshan Forum clearly provides a stage for developing countries to fully express themselves safety concerns and demands.

;

;;;;

;

;Main venue representatives of various countries. (Photo by Lu Huiqian)

;

;Southern Weekend reporters observed that among the parallel group meetings and seminars, 5 of them were themed on developing countries and the "Global South", and more than half of the speakers were from the development community. Chinese home.

;

;The "Global South" is not a new concept. The term was first used by American political activist Carl Oglesby as early as 1969. "European and American countries are using the Global South to exclude China from developing countries and isolate China to the maximum extent." Zhao Xiaozhuo believes.

;

;"China occupies a very critical or even core position in the global South. China's success has become the most important driving force for the global South at the international level...China has been promoting peaceful development through the 'One Belt, One Road' initiative, which can What is the United States doing?" Zheng Yongnian, President's Chair Professor of the Chinese University of Hong Kong (Shenzhen), asked on the morning of October 29.

;

;With concerns about the Palestinian-Israeli conflict, Selchuk Chorakkoglu, the founding director of the Asia-Pacific Research Center of Turkey, came to the Beijing Xiangshan Forum for the first time.

;

; "The Palestinian-Israeli conflict has caused nearly 10,000 deaths on both sides, and there are also hidden dangers of spillover." Selchuk told Southern Weekend reporters that he hopes to discuss how to discuss the "new Middle East security architecture" Providing new solutions to Palestine and Israel.

;

;Alessio Patalano has participated in the Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore and the Xiangshan Forum in Beijing for many times. He believes that the Beijing Xiangshan Forum is more "pragmatic".

;

;This professor at the Department of War Studies at King's College London is very talkative. As soon as the forum began, Alessio was interviewed for an hour by the media who came to ask for advice.

;

;He told Southern Weekend reporters that providing a platform for developing countries to speak out is one of the greatest advantages of the Beijing Xiangshan Forum.

;

;Defense ministers and representatives from various countries came to Beijing Xiangshan Forum with the vision of seeking peace.

;

;“Common security and lasting peace are the basis for the common development of all countries.” Itizal Khadim, director of the Afghanistan Development and Peace Research Center, told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In Afghanistan, Itizal is a former government official who is now a professor of modern political history. He joked to Southern Weekend reporters, "I came to the meeting wearing two 'hats.'"

;

;36 million people in Afghanistan are suffering from extreme poverty and hunger. "Only by creating jobs for the people, they will not turn to war." Itizal hopes that China can participate in the reconstruction of Afghanistan. "China can help developing countries promote economic and social development instead of distributing gunpowder."

;

;;(Southern Weekend interns Liu Yaqi, Lin Xi, Jiang Lai, Xu Ziyi, Feng Jiayi, and Zhang Xinyi also contributed to this article);

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 10:25:03 +0800 地理学家段义孚的终生追问：我是谁？http://www.infzm.com/contents/259775
;;2023-11-02 09:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Duan Yifu (third from right) in his later years with friends. ;(Photo courtesy of the publisher);

;

;Duan Yifu ended his autobiography "Who Am I?" with an encounter in middle age. 》.

;

;At night, he was driving on a narrow highway with only one car in front of him. He lacks confidence in his driving skills, so he uses the taillights of the car in front of him as a guide to gain a sense of safety and comfort. Suddenly the car flashed its right turn signal and turned into a country road. Visible to the naked eye, he was the only one driving on the road.

;

;;"So, only my own headlights are left to guide the way. This light can only illuminate a very small area. It is a short road, but this road, farther away, is swallowed up in darkness.";

;

;Yi-fu Tuan is a famous geographer and the founder of humanistic geography. One of the people. He intellectually understands the relationship between people and place and considers himself a cosmopolitan.

;

;"Who am I?" " was written in 1999, when Duan Yifu was 69 years old, and mankind was about to enter the new millennium. He sees "Who am I" as the fashionable question at the dawn of the new millennium. This issue actually received increasing attention as early as the 1960s, "In order to generate a solid sense of self, a person needs the past, not just the present and the future." It is worth mentioning that "Silent Spring" combined poetry and science in the 1960s to jointly examine the relationship between man and the environment.

;

;Duan Yifu continued to think about it and wrote important works in the next twenty years. "who I am? 》 is a good stage summary, showing sincere self-examination. He seems to be getting closer and closer to a location, but he is not sure when he will arrive, or even further away. The ideal position always changes with time, space and thinking.

;

;;

;

;In the early 1940s, Duan Yifu and his family were preparing to move from Chongqing to Australia. During the group photo, Yifu Duan (third from left) tried to squeeze away from his younger brother and stay close to his mother to gain more attention. ;(Photo courtesy of the publisher);

;

;;The world in his eyes;; is shrinking inward ;

;

;At the beginning, Yifu Tuan quoted the words of Socrates: An unexamined life is not worth living.

;

;Before middle age, Duan Yifu had never lived in any city for more than five years. After leaving China, he continued to move around until he moved to Minneapolis at the age of 38 and stopped to engage in academic work. Migration is inseparable from both my father's work and historical events. He believed he was rootless and "born to examine himself." He never married and could not fully integrate into American society, and the issue of identity was always there.

;

;He considers himself an optimist and "often places the golden age in the future." He knows that he gained his confidence early, having been relatively unscathed by racism while living abroad, and that later in life he began to question its source. His various ways of dealing with the world are closely related to the events he has experienced and the environment in which he lives. The book reveals his own “sense of place”—emotions and judgments about specific places.

;

;During his first interview at Indiana University in 1956, an Asian history professor was surprised by his family background. Duan Yifu recalled his childhood memories and was sure that the other party was not joking. According to what he heard, the Duan family was divided into two branches in modern times, both in Anhui. Duan Yifu's family belonged to the poor branch, and his father Duan Maolan relied on his uncle Duan Qirui from the Hefei branch to fully fund his studies at Nankai Middle School.

;

;Duan Yifu was born in Tianjin. From the age of 7 to 10, he lived in a village on the outskirts of Chongqing due to the war. His family was financially distressed. The school is a single room belonging to a power station. The place smelled sour and rancid, and the fetid mud dragged at his shoes. He was disgusted and horrified. Occasionally he encountered a funeral procession, with the bodies of the guards wrapped in bamboo mats. There is a rooster tied to it, which will crow if the corpse is found.

;

;;

;

;In 1954, Yifu Duan conducted field research in Arizona, USA. ;(Photo courtesy of the publisher);

;

;Small schools are different places, where students learn about the history, Culture and Technology. Wilde's work "The Happy Prince" left an indelible mark on him, and he knew: "'Good' can no longer be limited to fulfilling social obligations." These realizations inspired Duan Yifu to think, and he was always exploring how to determine a person's position in the world.

;

;Duan Yifu mentioned some important historical figures in his narrative. Duan Maolan and his alumnus Zhou Enlai wrestled with each other's arms to test whether the other's injured arm was healed. Zhang Boling, the principal of Nankai Middle School, had a rare refrigerator and distributed trays of ice cubes to everyone. In order to keep them for him, his father used the folk remedy of spreading salt to delay melting. The adults are still thinking about how to treat their distant relative Wang Jingwei.

;

;Duan Yifu has conflicting emotions about his father. He longs for love, but is disappointed by his father's preference for his brothers; he remembers the tenderness of the difficult times, but is also traumatized by his father's severity or anger. The most profound memory of my father is even just a childhood nightmare, and the scene in the dream has remained for many years:

;

;; "I opened my arms and wanted to hug him... What happened? But a ghost stood in front of me. It could be seen that it was my father, but he was covered in mourning clothes. This ghost was in the ever-changing airflow It was moving in the middle, weightless. It was an evil ghost, a corpse, with yellow light in its empty eyes.";

;

;The impression his mother left on him was warm and tough. , it’s a pity that she passed away prematurely. At the same time, Duan Yifu became increasingly sensitive due to his physical condition, and he became very ill for a time. He confessed his cowardice and unwillingness to participate in social change activities. Even in the face of racism and rude boys who treat him as a "little girl," he has no motivation to actively fight back.

;

;The world in Duan Yifu's eyes is shrinking inward. When he was a child, he was exposed to all kinds of extraordinary events. When he grew up, the war ended and he had to face many personal problems. He summed up this growth experience as moving from the universe to the stove, and used beautiful writing to integrate life and academia. He quoted the words of the poet TS Eliot:

;

;;"All of us, in our lifetime, have heard and seen , why does everything you feel (a bird singing, a fish leaping, an old woman walking on a mountain road) be reproduced with emotion, but other things are not?";

;

;;Youth Yifu Tuan. ;(Photo courtesy of the publisher);

;

;;Are you willing to be a lonely captain;;? ;

;

;“Poetry can break through the barriers or boundaries of language logic.” Liu Su told Southern Weekend. He used this to describe the beautiful words written by Tuan Yifu. He translated "Love Land Complex" and "Who Am I?" "Two books by Yifu Tuan, and I am currently translating "The Divided World and Self".

;

;When he was a graduate student around 2010, Liu Su often suffered from having no books to read. Many times he was attracted by the ideas mentioned in the book, but could not find relevant Chinese or even English translations. He tried his best to find the original work, went to Douban to ask Douban friends who had read the book, and also went to the library, but he might only be able to make half a copy.

;

;"I might as well translate it myself!" Those experiences inspired Liu Su's enthusiasm. He thus embarked on the path of academic translation, and future college students will no longer face the dilemma of reading. At the same time, many scholars have also participated in the translation and introduction of geography classics. The Chinese translations of scholars such as Tuan Yifu and David Harvey are enough to be compiled into a collection.

;

;In the summer of 2021, in the crowded Chongqing subway, Liu Su received a WeChat message from another translator Zhicheng, asking him if he was willing to translate "Who Am I?" 》. Even though the air conditioning was sufficient, he still broke out in a hot sweat: "This book will finally be translated into Chinese!" He had seriously considered that he was not willing to live a lonely life as a "foreigner" in a foreign country.

;

;"Who am I?" ” resonated with Liu Su’s heart. He experienced a long single life. When he got married, the children of his classmates were almost in junior high school. He may have experienced Duan Yifu's loneliness and his self-statement: "I spent a lot of time in poems and essays about the sadness of spring and autumn, and spent them in places like libraries and coffee shops.";

;Liu Su finished class, said goodbye to the students, and went to the library for a while after walking out of the teaching building. Even if I don’t write anything, I would still like to sit in the corner and experience what Yifu Duan said: “Living on campus almost all my life, surrounded by young people, makes me feel happy physically and mentally.” He sometimes goes to a nearby coffee shop and sits by the window, looking at the pedestrians, vehicles and street lights, feeling that loneliness is far away. The sensibility of exquisite language gathers together.

;

;Yi-Fu Tuan in 1998, that is, "Who Am I?" "The previous year's work "Escapism" asked: What is the greatest escape?

;

; "When you lower your head and manage the environment around you with a heart that loves your neighbor, you can also look up at the vast starry sky." Liu Su talked about his understanding of this sentence and added a more realistic side, "As a scholar, like him, I often look up at the starry sky of metaphysical thoughts and theories. However, whenever I look down at my single life, I often feel like I'm in a mess."< /p>;

;;

;

;Duan Yifu (1930-2022), an internationally renowned Chinese geographer, was born in Tianjin and graduated from Oxford University. He returned to China in his later years. ;(Photo courtesy of the publisher);

;

;Liu Su is looking for descriptions of single life in books. Yifu Tuan made his apartment simple and warm, dressed modestly and appropriately, maintained good health and longevity, had good interpersonal relationships, and gained precious friendships. However, "he once dreamed that he died alone at home, and no one found his rotting body." Duan Yifu always writes about his loneliness, a complicated feeling.

;

;"Perhaps the reason is that loneliness is the most authentic way of human existence. The state of not being lonely is actually the product of escape." Liu Su quoted the saying of "Escapism". There are three questions surrounding Yifu Duan's life: "I am mortal" that has lingered since childhood; "Who am I" related to individual consciousness; and "What is a good life". Yifu Tuan wrote "Geography saved me". Geography was like a road that led him to understand himself and the problems of human life.

;

;Translation of "Who am I?" " also allowed Liu Su to gain "a friendship worth cherishing." After the book launch, he, Zhi Cheng, editors and readers friends braved the heavy rain and went into a noodle shop to chat. Five people each signed five books and kept them. He also wanted to write his feelings into a longer email and share it with Duan Yifu. Before the email was finished, Duan Yifu passed away in August 2022.

;

;Tuan Yifu published a new book that year, and finally wrote: "I would like to advise you again, young traveler! You must be full of courage to operate your own ship like a captain, even though it is only Life's puzzling clues and stars serve as your guide."

;

;Liu Su was devastated by his mistake, but would continue to translate classics of humanistic geography. He also asked himself if he was willing to be a lonely captain and walk on a narrow road. No matter what the answer is, Tuan Yifu's book "will always be projected into the heart of every reader."

;

;;Where is the real home;

;

;Duan Yifu recalled in the preface of "Going Home" that people often asked him where he thought the real hometown was. . He answered lightly: "In general, it's the earth." "Where on earth is it?"

;

;Then, the meaning of the question is probably: there must be a place where he is most comfortable, The most yearning, can form the deepest sense of belonging. "Some specific landscapes do have great appeal to me, such as a landscape that transcends aesthetics - the desert. I feel that I am very close to the desert psychologically, and I can even regard it as my home." Yifu Duan again and again Once I wrote about my love for the desert.

;

;Beginning in the winter of 1954, Yifu Tuan was conducting field research for his doctoral thesis in southeastern Arizona. The research object was the desert terrain called the foothill erosion surface. When optimistic British student David Harris joins the group, the physical and spiritual hardships of the wilderness thin out and are gradually replaced by friendship.

;

;“This relationship brings me satisfaction, but it also causes insecurity—almost all relationships of any depth involve both. Why? Is there something wrong with me? ?" Duan Yifu asked in the book. In 1962, they collaborated again. He remained single and became a teacher; David married and had two daughters. "The David today is a broader, more elusive personality than I knew before."

;

;The following description is sensitive and stinging, and such feelings appear repeatedly in the book . They each drove to Chaco Canyon to investigate, with Yifu Duan leading the way and David's family following behind. At dusk, maybe David knew the route, maybe the children needed care, David's car honked, kicked up dust and drove ahead.

;

;;"The distance between us became wider and wider, and soon, all that was left in front of my eyes was the raised The dust was gone, and in the end, even the dust was gone. I fell into a lonely shadow... When I tried to catch up with the Harris family, I felt lonely and painful for the first time. What's worse, I I even feel ridiculous. What on earth was I doing on a dirt road in New Mexico? Chasing a young family in a car?";

;

;In Yifu Tuan's eyes, friendship must meet two basic requirements: The conditions—like-mindedness and sympathy—should be balanced in an ideal friendship. "If overly oriented toward shared interests and interests, these two people may become more like colleagues than friends; conversely, they may be more like lovers, staring into each other's eyes rather than into the world."

;

; ;"Shy people, unsociable people, or people like me who have their social needs suppressed by eccentric pursuits, perhaps should devote themselves to Nature...maybe only by staying in an inorganic environment, such as deserts and icebergs, can people feel relaxed and happy, and forget the good and the bad.";

;

;Yi-fu Duan also wrote about the German Alexander von Humboldt. Humboldt was the founder of modern physical geography. He “made outstanding contributions to the development of geodesy and was the first to use painting and poetry to develop human geographical experience-feelings, emotions and concepts, which are the core of humanities. The starting point of socialist geography”.

;

;Humboldt lived to be 90 years old and was full of energy throughout his life. In his sixties, he could still travel through Siberia and Central Asia. He enjoys socializing, but has never been married, and has been trapped in emotional entanglements with men three times. He wrote in a letter to the married soldier Reinhard von Haften: "Even if you reject me and look at me coldly, like a stain, I still want to be with you. ..."

;

;"If I leave the universe, or to be precise, leave the harmony of nature and the joy brought by human beings' ultimate achievements, my life will become miserable and I will not be able to survive." Yifu Duan listed He felt all kinds of human misery, "But, I don't want to stay in those shadows for a long time..." He believed in the light, the beauty of the universe, and the beauty and kindness of events. The next chapter is "Geography Saved Me."

;

;In 2005, taking the opportunity of attending an architectural conference, Yi-Fu Tuan returned to China after 60 years of absence and deliberately stayed for a while. He wrote a book called "Going Home", which was translated into Chinese by Zhicheng. During the trip to Chongqing, he once again mentioned the nightmare that had plagued him throughout his life. When his father passed away in Taipei in 1980, he did not go back to see him for the last time.

;

;The end of the autobiography is the contrast between the dim light of the car lights and the vast darkness. That is not despair. Duan Yifu is still looking at himself. He asked the translator to attach his speech notes in 2012 as an updated understanding of "who I am."

;

;"There are no so-called ordinary people in the world. The people you talk to every day are actually people with immortal souls... They joke with us, work together, and get married, but they are also ignored and exploited by us. All people are actually people with immortal souls. Among these people, some are immortal and terrifying, and some are immortal and brilliant."

;

;;Maybe it has been too long, he I really forgot;

;

;"Who am I?" "Yu Shiyi, the editor of "WeChat," appeared somewhat silent - just like when communicating with text on WeChat - but soon opened up the situation, became talkative and humorous. His daily schedule was very regular and he even added a short period of time that day.

;

;Later he added that he should not talk too much about his own story, and autobiographers should be given more space. So, this part is an extra chapter of this article. People are always faced with questions such as "Who am I?" The questions and answers constantly change with the situation, each covered with attractive colors. For example, the great director Bergman claimed that he knew less about himself than he did ten years ago.

;

;Yu Shiyi has unique feelings about discrete events. In early 1949, the Taiping shipwreck occurred in the waters west of Daishan Island where he was born. When he was a child, he had no idea about this tragedy. He only learned about it through documentaries when he left his hometown to attend college.

;

;In 1950, approximately 125,000 young men, soldiers, and 25,000 civilian personnel and civilians moved to Taiwan from Zhoushan, later forming the first generation of Zhoushan people of 20,000 to 30,000 people. The initiators of Taiwan’s Veterans Return Movement in 1987 were Zhoushan people. Before the “Three Direct Links”, it was very difficult for them to contact their homeland. The local historical materials exhibition hall uses an entire wall to display letters forwarded by the Red Cross at that time.

;

;Islands shape cognition. Yu Shiyi left Zhoushan for Ningbo ten years ago, and then went to Shanghai to study. When I was growing up, there was no cross-sea bridge in Zhoushan. When a typhoon came, the island became an isolated island, physically and psychologically isolated from the rest of the world. Compared to county towns, provincial towns, and cities, visitors from small islands seem to be “small” and marginal. At first he longed to merge from the margins into the mainstream, but now he wants to have subjectivity.

;

;“As an immigrant, your regional identity is the first thing that is mentioned when you arrive in a new environment.” Yu Shiyi has a friend who was born in Hubei and grew up in Shenzhen, and later moved to Shanghai. He asked: What is the local accent of “other”? In 1973, 43-year-old Yifu Duan officially became a U.S. citizen. He has been living in the United States for nearly two decades, debugging himself as a "cosmopolitan and a thinker writing about discrete subjects."

;

;There is also the little grandpa - my grandfather's younger brother - talking about the past during the Chinese New Year. He claimed that he once drove a simple diesel-powered boat from Qushan Island to Dongjiadu, Shanghai, in one night. Alone, without a GPS, all I have is experience and a compass. Yu Shiyi could not imagine the plight of the fishermen. Wouldn't they be scared if they were wandering around without land? He wrote down his boundless imagination in his notes:

;

;;The lanky man drove a small sampan from the island Set off and drive northwest, through night and day, to Dongjiadu. The lighting system at that time was not perfect, and there was no positioning system. Some waterways were almost dark at night, but he arrived at his destination safely without saying a word about the wind and waves he encountered. I think maybe too much time has passed and he has long forgotten the ups and downs along the way. ;

;

;;I remember that there is a famous lighthouse on Flower and Bird Island. I wonder if he passed by it. Under certain conditions, There will also be the wonder of the fluorescent sea. I always feel that the waterway from my hometown to Shanghai is full of mysterious powers. I once took a ferry from the island to Shanghai. I landed ashore at dusk and landed at dawn. That was the first time I saw the waves gurgling like spring water and seagulls soaring in the sky. Looking out from the small round glass of the third-class cabin, there are faint lights. Maybe I have seen the lighthouse of Flower and Bird Island. ;

;

;;I asked the tribesmen, have you gone ashore? He said he had unloaded the goods but did not go up. I was so sorry. I wanted to get the secrets of Shanghai in the 1980s from him, but he said, it’s nothing. The Bund is just across the Dongjia Ferry Road. I can’t understand those Western things. At that time, everything could be bought by ticket, and the people were people on the water. , naturally cannot be obtained. He drove the sampan up the Huangpu River and finally reached Jiangyin. This was undoubtedly an adventure. As for what to do there and how to get back to the island, he stopped talking without saying a few words. Maybe it's been too long and he really forgot. ;

;

;Memories and narratives form fragments one after another, embedded in life. More than thirty years after my grandfather left Shanghai, Yu Shiyi also arrived in Shanghai. During the National Day holiday in 2022, he took a boat to the island with his father. The father was hesitant at first, after all, the house was no longer theirs. Many places are different. Old houses and new ones are popping up one after another. Fortunately, the road remains where it is.

;

;Yu Shiyi returned to the lane where he was born. The commercial house he bought more than 20 years ago was still there, but it was older. The back door was open, he went in and saw the washboard from many years ago. After all these years, it's still there, like a miracle. There was someone living nearby, and he was too embarrassed to disturb him, so he just wanted to go to the front door to take a look.

;

;When the resident saw the stranger, he became alert and asked: "Who are you?" Yu Shiyi was stunned, silent for a few seconds, and instinctively replied: "This is my home." He walked to the front door and took a photo Teru then left.

;

;"You have become the 'other'." He recalled, "There are physical things, and it used to be my home." He didn't know how many hands the house had changed. I felt relieved that I could finally say goodbye. For almost twenty years, he always thought of this home, worried about it, and was afraid it would be demolished. Now all the playmates and neighbors have left, leaving only photos and washboards.

;

;The recognition and memory of your hometown, in turn, become the means for others to identify you. Not long after being asked "Who are you?", in December 2022, Yu Shiyi took over "Who Am I?" ", the book will be launched at the Shanghai Book Fair in August 2023. The above is always a bit of an unexpected fate.
